Reviews.Title: “Central Reasonably Priced Small Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: PaulWimbledon
Reviews.Content: When I stayed there a few Years ago,the Hotel was a lower end priced in the Middle of Venice Hotel. No great views but if you don't fancy walking more than a few feet to the main square then its ideal. It was clean,with a lift,marble in places decent enough hotel. Yes I remember a few mosquitos-the norm in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby Hotel Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ron d
Reviews.Content: It's hard to beat the location which is just a few steps from St. Mark's Square.We were on the 1st floor the room was not very big and extremly hot because the air con was not switched on we were informed at reception that it was only used during the summer months, however they switched off the heating to our room which did not make a lot of difference. The room needed decorating there was a damp spot on the wall adjacent to the bathroom where the shower was, the wallpaper was patched instead of being replaced. We had a safe in the room which we used. The bed was very comfortable & the towels were changed daily.The staff were helpful & friendly. The hotel has a small bar if you want a drink in the evening. For a 3 day break this hotel is Ok.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location...nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: Lampasasite
Reviews.Content: It's hard to beat the location which is just a few steps from St. Mark's Square! There are a whole lot of restaurants moments away. The room was clean, spacious and well equipped. We went there during the carnival, so when we did (finally) try to sleep, there was a lot of noise in the room from the street. You might be able to ask for a room which doesn't have a window which opens towards the street. The complimentary breakfast was very nice as well. In summary, a great place to stay on your vacation to Venice!

Reviews.Title: “MOSQUITO infested, AIR CONDITIONING doesn't work, worse WIFI connection, but GREAT LOCATION!”
Reviews.Author: LESERLEE23
Reviews.Content: PRO: Greaaaaat location. Close to St Mark's Square! The filipino guy at the front desk was so helpful. My fiancÃ© and I would leave our room in the middle of the night to take night photos...although, there is another reason why we would have to leave in the middle of the night... CONS: IT WAS RIDICULOUSLY HOT DURING ALL HOURS OF THE DAY IN THE ENTIRE HOTEL! We heard other pple complaining & they said their AC just wasn't working. It was so unbearable that we couldn't stay in our room. Their Internet is horrible! It's like being in a dungeon trying to connect to their wifi. Their graveyard shift front desk person was so rude too, you could tell he hated his job. We found ourselves attempting to kill as many mosquitoes as we could in our room bc we always woke up w new bites. The room was very dusty and bathroom was rusty. I wouldn't stay here again. It ruined a lot of my stay in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “great location,comfortable, friendly hotel.”
Reviews.Author: wiggo1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from 28/3 till 31/3. The location of this hotel is excellent, just a minute walk away - a few streets from St Marks Sq. We found Alex and the staff very friendly and informative. Our room -263-had been refurbished one week previous in Gold Venicitian style - the new bathroom was lovely but needed a shelf to place your toiletries on. The breakfast was of a continental style, cereals, breads, cheese, meat, fruit with lots of tea and coffee. very adequate. Thank you...We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel and would definately book here again. Loved Venice and will be back.

Reviews.Title: “nice little hotel, close to St Mark's square”
Reviews.Author: drchloe83
Reviews.Content: this is a reasonably priced hotel, and overall was a good place to stay. it was relatively easy to find (behind st mark's square) and the staff on reception were helpful and friendly. our room was at the top of the building (452), and it was a bit of a trek to get there (using two lifts and through some little corridors) - but the room was clean and well presented, with a large bed, shower over a jacuzzi bath and a flat screen TV. the only down side of the room was that it was very hot - even in March. we had to have to windows open, which meant that the mossies came in and we could hear the bell on the square every hour! breakfast was simple, but the croissants were nice. coffee not great :-(

Reviews.Title: “fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Vanessa B
Reviews.Content: very good, service and location!!! breakfast is filling and simple, even got an upgraded room!!

Reviews.Title: “I would rather have slept in the corridor”
Reviews.Author: Binaberry
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for a 3 night stay because it was in a good location and we got a good deal on hotel and flights. I was expecting the room to be basic as it was a low price and we had booked a standard room. However, the room was not pleasant at all. The main problem was the mosquitos. While not very nice, I could live with a couple but there were more than that and the walls and net curtain were stained with squashed mosquitos, which looked disgusting. I have also been bitten a number of times. The cleaner, also unhelpfully left the window open which attracted more (which seems silly given there is an obvious problem) and did not clean the bathroom tiles or walls where previous occupiers had squashed them. I am surprised that with such an obvious problem, the hotel had not provided a zapper in the room. In addition, the room was extremely hot (this was in March) and when we tried the air conditioning it only blasted hot air. We asked at reception and they said they would turn off the heat to enable the air con but this didn't work and the room was extremely uncomfortable to be in, especially as we were unable to open the windows due to the mosquitos. The room itself was a good size but in need of a paint and clean to remove the dead mosquitos and there was also a large damp patch above the bed. The carpet was also worn and did not reach the edge of the room in places. The bathroom was clean (but not the tiles) and the bed sheets were also clean. The breakfast was very basic - croissants, bread and yoghurt. There was a selection of meats but this ran out and was not replaced. During our stay there was a lot of loud banging as it seemed builders were working on one of the rooms nearby, however we were not warned that this would be happening. Lastly, when we arrived the receptionist was on the phone asking someone to give them a 10 on Trip Advisor (not sure he realised it's out of 5!) because he said the reviews aren't that great. Not a good impression to begin with really, although I can say that he was very friendly and welcoming. It's just a big shame about the quality of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Stanislaw K
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just one big surprise: low prices, perfect location, comfortable room, courteous staff both at the reception and in the breakfast room, good quality food. Best value for low price!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for the low price”
Reviews.Author: Vitaly P
Reviews.Content: Located down a quieter narrow street just a few minutes walk from St. Mark's square. In an area with plenty of lower priced eating options for families. Excellent water bus access. Good breakfast variety. Cereals, meats, cheese, yoghurt, fruit, jams and toast. Surprising for Italy! The hotel staff was responsive to our needs and very pleasant. We were also very happy with the cleanliness and just everything about our experience there was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “What a lovely property!”
Reviews.Author: toddcopper
Reviews.Content: My mom and I traveled to Italy alone and stayed in this hotel on our trip to Venice. We felt completely safe here and loved the convenience of being close to any attraction you might want to see in Venice. This hotel is right off San Marco square and is well decorated and quite roomy for a European hotel. Service was excellent and we were quite pleased with our stay. If ever back in Venice, I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly positioned”
Reviews.Author: OxfordLady63
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from four nights in the hotel. I had an en suite single room for a ridiculously low price and felt my initial low expectations rise to a buoyant pleasure on arrival. The staff were courteous , efficient and helpful. Breakfast was served by a waitress who remembered what kind of coffee I had on the second morning and I was warm and comfortable on the second floor, undisturbed by street noise, even though I needed to open the window when the heating became a bit claustrophobic. The room was spotless, marble lined bathroom and clean towels every day. The sheets were high quality and also changed mid stay. I could be in front of St Mark's in less than a minute and it felt so good to be close to everything. This was outstanding value. Good food, warm hospitality and little kindnesses like free WiFi and English newspapers made it a pleasure to return each evening. The sky was cloudless all week. January was a perfect time to visit.

Reviews.Title: “so close you felt you were in one of the palazzo's!”
Reviews.Author: BerniethePub
Reviews.Content: Booked via booking.com & got a tremendous deal. Arrived to find the Friendliest reception staff ever.. Shown to our room just one floor up, overlooking the tiny street...walls of gold padded material , floors of thick carpet, air conditioning, super double glazing...two extra sofa beds that were upholstered to match the rest...rich damask & cord brocades... & the most amazing huge Murano glass chandelier ! round the corner to a dressing area with huge wardrobe & a free safe ( set your own code, etc) , then into the bathroom...Amazing!!! twin sinks, huge mirror, full length bath, with tremendously powerful shower above, , WC & bidet, plus heated towels.. Heaven! The room was cleaned thoroughly each day, as was the bathroom...full mini bar fridge if you want it.. breakfast was good continental... cereals, milk, plain yoghurts, honey, jams ,fresh fruits,, etc, plus croissants, breads, toast etc. juice, then an abundance of fresh sliced cheese, salami, mortadella & thin shaved cooked ham. Have the tea.... individual pots, just grab a little milk jug from under the cupboard, cos they don't seem to think you have milk with it... coffee was a let down, from a syrup type machine, but that was the ONLY thing throughout the stay. The service staff were matriarchal & jolly.... There's a lounge with English ( amongst others )newspapers, and a bar that seemed to open after we'd left each evening. Less than 1 minute walk from the side door of St marks, its amazing! We had no queues for any tourist sites, or anything all the stay... go in January but keep warm! The room itself was toasty warm :o)

Reviews.Title: “We were pretty lucky...”
Reviews.Author: naphthalin
Reviews.Content: Since we were upgraded from a low-budget hotel around the corner to Hotel Panada I can't say anything about how adequat or inadequate the prices they usually ask for are. We were really lucky because we got a more than nice room (considering our low-budget standards): clean, wooden floor, very quiet at night - facing a backyard, with a minibar, a safe (which we didnt get to work though), a tv, and even - best of all - a jacuzzi-tub. Breakfast was nothing special, but good - the only thing surprising was that the coffee wasnt any good...

Reviews.Title: “pleasant stay, terrible aftermath”
Reviews.Author: risal
Reviews.Content: The room, up in the eaves, was pleasant and the bathroom was good but for a broken loo seat, but the broken lift was being extracted by what sounded like a power drill, so getting to my room meant going up two flights of stairs, down one, and then up another three very steep flights (or braving the lift that ran only from the first floor, but there can't be a slower lift anywhere in Europe; once was enough). So far so good, but a week later my face, neck and arms are still covered with red blotches from the more than 50 three-in-a-line bedbug bites I suffered there. It may be cheapish by Venice standards, but I wish I'd spent more on a better-class hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: tilper-7
Reviews.Content: This is not a top class hotel - but it was cheap - and was good value for the money. It is very close to San Marco - I could see the church domes across the roof opposite from my room. Which was a good size if rather unconventional: as it was in the eves it was low in places and the windows were small, so it was rather dark (though the lighting was OK). It was well decorated and fitted out. I suspect this is one of the special budget rooms for on-line bookers! The WiFi was great (once they sorted out a problem by restarting the router), but TV picture was poor. Others have noted about the maize getting to (some) rooms - this was the case for my room (500 - apparently - though there was no number on the door). The climb was a hassle - and the lift was the slowest I have ever known. Having said that the room was quite - even the noise from the street was moderate - which was good. Breakfast: basic and limited but OK - nice croissant(s) (dreadful coffee - as hotel coffee nearly always is - but this is Italy). One problem though - Mosquitoes - which I didn't expect in November. But this is not really the Hotel's fault - they did supply some spray when I asked (though the receptionist was a bit reluctant). If you intend to spend your time out and about and not in your hotel room - this is a reasonable / good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Long stay or short - this hotel is a winner in the beautiful city of Venice!”
Reviews.Author: AliceLIkesAdventures
Reviews.Content: Once you have caught your breath after seeing the beautiful 'floating' city of Venice, you will find this hotel only a short walk from the famous San Marco Square. The hotel itself is also a beauty - it's walls are adorned with beautiful Italian art - the rooms have been carefully restored to pristine 18th century charm with modern conveniences. The staff is very friendly and accomodating - up to escorting you to your dinner location to make sure you find your way. A delightful find in Venice - I will book a longer stay on my next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Not a best place in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Perstinentia
Reviews.Content: Nicely located near St Marco. But be ready to meet tough and always very busy staff, hotel is a true labyrinth, a broken lift is at your disposal, and insects inside are welcomed

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Richard S
Reviews.Content: Everyone of the staff was most helpful, and made our stay the most enjoyable of our Mediteranian Cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and central”
Reviews.Author: Malbear
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is located in the crowded hinterland of the nightmare that is St Mark's Square. However it is very central and is well run and the reception staff are welcoming and friendly. My single room was quite small but was very attractively furnished. It had a TV of course and efficient air conditioning. Also there was a safe at no extra cost. Compared to the size of the room the bathroom was very spacious and well appointed with an excellent and roomy shower. The breakfast buffet was just average and you had to ask the waitress each time you wanted a coffee refill and the coffee wasn't very good. I wondered why the window shutters in my room were left closed. When I checked the view I was taken aback to discover a huge industrial unit directly outside the window. It must have been the hot water system or air conditioning for the entire hotel. So if this doesn't appeal avoid Room 114. The cost of the room was about Â£100 per night B&B which is a Venice in season price and there is a new tax of 3â‚¬ per night per person slapped on top.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location in the heart of Venice”
Reviews.Author: julie F
Reviews.Content: The hotel was small and friendly, the rooms were typically venetian, chandelier's and opulent drapery. However the pillows on all the beds were the worse i have ever experienced ,laying on a bag of set concrete would have been more comfortable ,however the excellent air conditioning eased us through the nights. Overall the stay was very pleasent.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable stay in unbeatable location”
Reviews.Author: fussweh
Reviews.Content: an unbeatable location down a very narrow street two minutes from st. mark's square. i requested and received a quiet non-smoking single room #224. the room was bigger than expected, and even had a big comfy armchair. the a/c worked very well on hot august nights. furnishings were traditionally styled and very comfortable. rate booked was reasonable for location and high season, but varies day by day. breakfast was pretty basic and repetitive. use of lobby computers was payable, and net connection not very good. nice to have a small comfortable lounge, but the bar was never open. the adjoining restuarant called ai speci ( not sure if same ownership/management) should be avoided at all costs. a total rip-off, even by venetian standards.

Reviews.Title: “So bad that I can't forget”
Reviews.Author: xmNz23
Reviews.Content: At every trip there is something unforgettable to me. In my Venice trip I can't forget how bad that hotel was. Interior of this hotel is like a labyrinth. To get my room I needed to change 2 elevators and climb lots of stairs. It was like they wanted to bore me to make me sleep. The beds were unqualified and it seemed the ceiling in the bathtub is designed for 12 or 10 year old children. Definitely not designed for tall persons. Internet made me crazy. There is a problem with their internet and they didn't admit. Whenever I tried to connect to the other hotel's internet it connected but Antico Palada's internet wasn't working and the personnel didn't admit something was wrong. The only good thing about this hotel was its location.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and value. Would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: SporkJ
Reviews.Content: The hotel is quite easy to get to as long as you have a decent map. It is less than a minute away from St. Mark's Square. We stayed 3 nights and had a double room and twin room (both 138 Euro's per room, per night) next door to each other. Both the rooms were clean, air conditioned, nicely decorated and not too bad in size. They also provided a safe in each room free of charge. The breakfast buffet was quite good and had a variety of items - an ideal opportunity to save money as meals in Venice are quite expensive. I think that maybe a mini fridge and some tea/coffee making facilities would have benefited the rooms but overall the hotel was good value for money and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Les101
Reviews.Content: It was a challenge to find the hotel, but we arrived the staff were very helpful. Our room was small but adequate. Our breakfast was fine with the exception of the coffee. We had a coffee elsewhere. We enjoyed our drinks in their bar which was were served by a friendly barman.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: lauv
Reviews.Content: Location isn't just perfect because of the San Marco area, it's very convenient considering to airport- and railway station-traffic, as San Marco's water bus stop is very near. Hotel is quite a labyrinth, as it's in a very old building, lots of stairs and corridors. I had to use two separate elevators to get in my room, which was in fifth floor. But what a view I had! There were only two small windows, but I got straight view to St Mark's clock tower and statues of the roof of the Doge's palace. Room was clean and well maintained, I even got a jacuzzi. Wi-fi was working well and it was free of the charge. Breakfast was good average, all basics except warm dishes. I definitely choose this hotel again if I go back to Venice!

Reviews.Title: “"Awful"”
Reviews.Author: Spandau8
Reviews.Content: The only good thing about this hotel is it's location (situated only a few meters from St. Mark's Square) however, dont let this make you stay there. The single room I stayed in was tiny and the bed (or should I say concete slab) was just about big enough for me (I'm only 5'6" so God help anyone who is tall or on the heavy -side). The hotel bar is awful and pricey although Venice is expensive anyway. During the day the lobby and waiting area, which are both tiny, are crammed with luggage which you have to negotiate passed to get to the lift which just about big enough for you and one case. I didnt find the staff in the slightest bit friendly. I had to charge my phone in the reception as the sockets in the room did not take the european adapter which I brought (it worked everywhere else I used it). The screen on my iphone is bigger than the 1970's TV screen in the room (slight exaggeration but you know what I mean). Asking the staff for directions was an ordeal in itself and also there are no tourist leaflets, information, maps etc in the reception which I would have thought was a must for any hotel. It pains me to even type about this hotel as I just want to forget I ever stayed there. I would rather have slept on a bench than spend another night there. Oh yeah, the mobile phone signal was non existent inside the hotel for the majority of my stay so I had to spend most of my time out of the hotel which suited me just fine. I had an early start when I was leaving and requested an alarm call which never came and I realised why when I got down to the reception as the guy behind the desk was fast asleep. Having said all of the above I do have to say that the hotel is spotless clean but thats all I can say for it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location off of San Marco Square”
Reviews.Author: BabeRog
Reviews.Content: Hotel's jewel is its location; close to everything. The hotel was duing renovations which they greatly need to continue. Our room was adequate and bathroom well appointed. Downsides were the poor Wifi; we had to go to an internet cafe and pay for service after three days. The lobby seating area needs new furniture, but comfortable. The shower wall was moldy but it worked fine. I liked the front desk staff; they were friendly and humorous. The breakfast was the worst of our entire 2+week trip. Considered a continental breakfast only...yogurt, a couple of cerals, delicious corisants, oj and coffee. I guess there was a cheese and meat platter. Price was $300 a night for location - This hotel has loads of potential if they put some money back into it.

Reviews.Title: “Rather sleep on the street!!”
Reviews.Author: Luly44
Reviews.Content: Booked 2 standard twin rooms, they were minute, 1 foot of space between them and walls. Televisions were portable size boxes, shower rooms cubicles, room temp was 30 degrees according to thermostat and air conditioning/heating unit did not appear to work and when we opened windows we wished we hadn't as the stink was indescribable. Went to ask reception to turn on the air conditioning, this was not possible as it was only April and air conditioning can not be turned on until June. I asked to speak to the Manager who was not available, reception telephoned him, when he turned up he took a telephone call whilst I waited for 10 minutes. I told him that the rooms were unacceptable and either he gave me a refund or moved us to more acceptable rooms. After much haggling we were moved to 2 twin rooms at the very top of the hotel, which were supposedly Superior rooms. Well beware if you have booked one of these, the travelling time from reception to room is approx 10 mins and involves 2 lifts, 4 flights of stairs, 3 security doors (key card required) a visit to another hotel and numerous corridors. Getting lost is a distinct possibility! Whilst these rooms were slightly more spacious, slightly cooler, had slightly bigger TV's and didn't smell when you opened the windows, you were likely to bang your head on the beams. The single pillow was like a rock, there were no towels or loo roll and the rooms came with an added bonus of 2 sets of bells (the clock tower and the Bell Tower) chiming on the hour every hour but approx 5 mins apart, so you could get the full effect of each toll and ensure that you had an extremely bad nights sleep. Having said this, the bells could be a problem in any hotel located close to St. Mark's Square? So after a delightful nights sleep we were looking forward to a fortifying breakfast, alas this was not to be. We had to wait to get a table and then were treated to an overstewed cup of coffee, fake orange juice, one small croissant each and the toaster that warmed the bread and had to go round 3 times before it resembled toast. Thank goodness we were only staying one night, we couldn't leave the place fast enough.

Reviews.Title: “3 star hotel, nothing more”
Reviews.Author: serumx
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel at the beginning of april and have the following comments: - Nice location some 100 meters from San Marco square - When I arrived the room temperature was about 26 degrees. As it was out of season they would not start the aircondition. Opening the windows did'nt help much either. You could'nt sleep with them open anyway because of outdoor noise. - Room was quite tiny - but otherwise ok - Breakfeast - nice personell - ok food. All in all a big minus because of the temperature, otherwise an ok hotel.

Reviews.Title: “My third time at the Panada Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelerForPleasure
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent. The service used to be a little better at the front desk years ago. The room was a little small but it is ok because you are in it just for sleep. I'll keep going to the Panada when visiting Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Very good experience”
Reviews.Author: venicefan2003
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice,clean and very good for its price.The location is the key!Our room was 137, which was in a sort of a next building overlooking Best Western Hotel and needed to walk all the way through the second and first floor.But it is not a problem,because the room was big and nice,the bathroom was very well equipped and it was very,very CLEAN.The breakfast is excellent-there is two or three mature ladies,very attentive and polite.The morning coffee is fantastic and there is more than enough choice of food! Reception staff was very efficient and nice with a good command of english.I can highly recommend this hotel and pass my regards to the staff and the management and simply to tell them-WELL DONE and THANK YOU!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel with room for improvement”
Reviews.Author: lmf85
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a great location and was very quiet. The room itself was quite small but is perfect of you are not spending alot of time in there. Very clean. The downside was the heating system. We found the room very hot but couldnt turn the heating off or down. We had to open the window which in turn let in the mosquito's who took a shine to my husband! He suffered some quite bad bites so I would recommend to take some repellent and some cream! The breakfast was awful! The toaster didnt work very well and no matter how many times you put the bread through, it didnt toast! The coffee was awful and tasted like the cheapest Instant coffee you could buy. This was very disappointing! The bar was nice but very quiet and pricey! I personally wouldnt come back to the hotel. We didnt pay a great deal of money but I would expect any hotel to have a nice breakfast and a working heating system!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value For Money”
Reviews.Author: TravelFoodPhil
Reviews.Content: Great place, very nice room for the price. Room and bathroom clean and everything working and compared to the other places in Venice a very reasonable price. Staff also friendly and breakfast was a good standard. Also right next to St Marco Piazza so in the heart of everything, defo recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Good Value”
Reviews.Author: tnatalie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel and were pleasantly suprised how good the location was, close to St Marks Square. The room was clean and tidy however as we on the 2nd floor it was very warm, we attempted to turn it down but to no avail. We opened the windows instead. Breakfast was a fairly standard continental breakfast- the coffee was great though. The shower was great a power shower. The only downside to an otherwise lovely hotel was the ridiculous prices at the bar 5 Euros for a can of sprite and we brought our own wine to have in the room and they tried to charge us for a couple of glasses, other than that super value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Nice Staff”
Reviews.Author: travelingsis02
Reviews.Content: Three sisters, 2 teens and 1 - 10 year old. One night...Two rooms in an alcove on the 2nd floor. Perfect for all of us! Hotel was small, nice and cozy. Very small elevators though. One room had a distinctive odor that we just couldn't pinpoint the smell. We opened the windows and looked onto the narrow Venice street. It was very cool to hear and see the people below. Faucet in one of the bathrooms dripped and when we reported it, they were not concerned enough to fix it. Location was so close to St Mark's Sq, which made the hotel even better. The staff was exceptional! They recommended the restaurant next door for dinner, which we found out was owned by the hotel. It was way overpriced and the food was lousy. The waiter was unclean looking too. They charged a 15% service fee and a table fee which came to 1/3 of the cost of our meal. Woud not recommend this restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great staff the perfect room”
Reviews.Author: hedgehog313
Reviews.Content: We stay at the hotel on November 5 to the 7, it was a little hard to find but we ask and people directed us to the place. When we got there they took us across the street telling us we where staying on the newer side i was nervous because when the open the door of the hall way it was old so we climb the stairs to our suprise a really nice room was waiting for us. The breakfast was really good and the staff was really nice to us I will stay there again. we had a triple room was very big my 19 year old had her room and we had our room it was great. I love venice and the panada hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Marvelous”
Reviews.Author: RED059
Reviews.Content: I took my Mum for a mothers day surprise, it was one of the best rooms i've ever stayed in. The booking was a last minute deal and we had one of the largest rooms, whirlpool bath etc, but just paid a normal fee, but later found out the room was a superiour room. So it was well worth the money. I was so impressed i'm taking my Mum back again next March, to the same hotel. ( My Mum had visited Venice with my Dad on their honeymoon, so Mum likes Venice a lot). The hotel is so close to St Marks Square, you can hear the clock strike 7.00am so no need for an alarm. The hotel staff are more helpful in low season, so they treated Mum like royalty. I friendly, clean, perfect location, ideal holiday hotel, I can reccomend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location and Great Service”
Reviews.Author: JasmineMarti
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a terrific location, steps from San Marco Square. My room was rather small, but that's to be expected. The bathroom was immaculately clean, and appeared newly refurbished. They have a very decent breakfast. The staff are exceptionally good on giving walking directions. This was not my first trip to Venice, so I wanted to explore more out-of-the-way places, and their directions were fantastic. A tip for shopping in Venice: beware, as some of the trinkets posturing as Murano glass may actually be made in China.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Staff & Great Breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Sim0011
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Venice after a horrific 19 hour train ride [which should have only taken 12!]. When we checked in, we were lucky enough to encounter "Alex" at front reception. He spoke great english and could not be more helpful and understood the horrific journey we had just had and did his best to be accommodating. Great advice on food, where to go in Venice and what to do. We took him up on all his suggestions and could not be more pleased. Breakfast and staff at breakfast were exceptional. Amongst the be coffee and Cornetto's I've ever had! Location was superb. I travel a bit for both work and pleasure, so it was great to see that quality service does still exist out there. A big thank you to Alex as he definitely made the stay go much smoother for our 7 nights in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Warm in the January snow”
Reviews.Author: nokkla
Reviews.Content: The hotel rooms at Antica Panada are old Italian style. You feel in Italy in them. They are warm, in temperature and dÃ©cor. Considering we arrived at the hotel at midnight, in January, and after a long walk in snow (yes, a rare occurrence but true indeed!) our rooms were a lovely welcome. The hotel is just behind Piazza San Marco. We actually could see the bells of the Basilica full of snow from our room. We walked our way to Piazza San Marco from Piazzale Roma were all coaches stop and it took us about 45 minutes, maybe a bit more until you get orientated. I would suggest a water taxi to Piazza San Marco area if you have something more than a small hand luggage. Beware, Venice is full of bridges with steps so it might not be very easy with a large, maybe heavy, luggage. Breakfast was ok. Continental breakfast in a small breakfast room. No coffee making facilities. All three rooms used by our family had Jacuzzi and all were supplied with bath not showers. Staff was Ok. We were a bit hungry at our arrival but the restaurants were all closed. We were offered a cappuccino, which isnâ€™t much, but at least we the receptionist offered us the least he could. The hotel is extended onto another building. This means lots of steps, corridors and doors to walk through. I would have probably got lost walking from reception to our room even on our third day. Our room was at the other extreme point of the other part. There was also a common area for our hotel, another one star hotel and possibly some residences. It is all rather safe however as doors to both parts of the hotel are open through the room cards and are usually kept closed. However, the â€˜bestâ€™ part of the â€˜tripâ€™ to get to our room were the VERY STEEP stairs just outside our rooms (have a look at the photos), which seemed a bit too much at the end of it all. A small point, we noted a very large crack in one of the walls, which makes you think that if there were to be an earthquake the building would crumble down within seconds. But I do not think it is a point for not staying there as the vast majority of buildings in Italy is in that state unfortunately. I consider our stay well priced, comfortable and very central. Would only ask for a room in the reception and breakfast room part would I have to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Poor customer Service”
Reviews.Author: peteandcarolbrisbane
Reviews.Content: If you expect at least a minimum stand of customer service, do not stay in this hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Jan054
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel has to be the location, situated within a couple of minutes walk from San Marco. The room we had was a superior room, which I would recommend, having stayed previously in a standard room. Having said that, you don't go to Venice to stay in your room! The layout is different to say the least, our room was supposed to be on the second floor but to reach it involved going up and then down stairs and along several corridors! However, this to me just added to the character of the hotel. I would deffinitely recommend this hotel and if I go back to Venice would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not much value for money”
Reviews.Author: vop63
Reviews.Content: The location is indeed very central, just 2 minutes from S. Marco. The hotel is located is on a very narrow but busy passage and if the windows face this street then good sleep is not guaranteed. The lobby though being small is clean and is freshly renovated. But the room... The one which was called tripple room was tiny, run-down with stains of seeping water on the ceiling, wall-paper was very old and somewhere scratched. Claims about antique furniture is correct to the point it is very old. The strange thing was that the bathroom which was Ok with new fixtures. Internet in the hotel wasn't cheap and was hard to connect. I tried to minimize my contacts with the staff because they didn't look very eager to oblige, while not being outright rude.

Reviews.Title: “Awful staff !!! would never stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: ILoveholidays12
Reviews.Content: We had picked this hotel for it's central location, which was really good for sight- seeing. Firstly the room we got was TINY for the price we paid, the bathroom was like some portable cubicle. My hubby and me couldnt stand in the room at the same time, if one of us stood up the other had to be on the bed..that was how tiny the room was. The scene from the window was terrible, it looked like someone else's house back alley. What spoilt it fully for us was when we bought wireless internet from the hotel which wasnt cheap! We then found it wasnt working from our room. We then informed their staff who couldnt help us. On check out we asked if we could get a refund for the internet as we couldnt use it. The manager was sooo RUDE and Nasty to us, it was absolutely shocking!!! They obviously feel they dont need to provide customer service because of their location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent room and good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: JaneLoireValley Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: The room we had was of a good size and very nicley furnished with hand painted furniture in Italian sttyle. On suite had over the bath shower but lots of hot water and plenty of room. Breakfast was buffet style - plenty to eat incuding peach filled croisants, buns, museali/corn flakes, yoghurts,toast, various meats, cheese & freash fruit. All good by Itaian standards. Location - very close to San Marks Sq so ideal for first time visitors.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Carnivale”
Reviews.Author: Sonicdbd
Reviews.Content: Great location only 5 mins for San Marco square. Street that the hotel is on is typical of Venice, very narrow. We stay at Carnivale and were surprised that the room was pretty quiet. Occasional street noise, but not enough to keep you awake. Room was clean, bed was not too hard and we asked for extra pillows and received them with no problem Service was excellent and breakfast typical for Italy. Great location and price for Venice. I will definitely stay here again next year for Carnivale.

Reviews.Title: “In the Heart of Venice”
Reviews.Author: VP1398
Reviews.Content: We have been in this hotel in the last weekend of January. It is situated in the heart of Venice, one minute walk from Piazza San Marco. The hotel is very well kept. The rooms are nice and cosy. The bathrooms are equipped with Jacuzzi. The room also had climate control. We paid about â‚¬37 per person per night, which was very worth it, when you remember especially the location of this jewel of a hotel. I would strongly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel, shame about the staff”
Reviews.Author: sandiel
Reviews.Content: this could be a lovely hotel, ideally placed for sighteseeing, being about a 2 minute stroll from st marks square. the room was small but adequate and clean, however the staff, without exception were surly and arrogant, a request for coffee was met with a snapped reply of "Closed", asked when the bar opened, the same sort of response, "closed". in fact the bar never opened in the 4 nights we were there, and i never saw any member of staff smile at or greet any guest pleasantly, our stay was not an enjoyable experience i could only recommend this hotel for its position.

Reviews.Title: “Venice in love”
Reviews.Author: GSoi
Reviews.Content: We reached venice and had our ebooking with us, found the hotel with ease as it was 20 steps away from Piazza San Marco which we reached by boat. The staff was polite and due to over booking we were upgraded to a deluxe bedroom in the new wing without any extra charges. Got a jacuzzi with that wich was awesome. The breakfast was not that extensive but enough if you are a traveller and yes you do get warm freshly baked croissants.

Reviews.Title: “Too expensive for a standard hotel.”
Reviews.Author: afmachado
Reviews.Content: The hotel has an excellent location, near to the San Marco Square. Unfortunately, they do not make efforts to be nice. We have stayed in 6 hotels in Italy and this was the most expensive and the poorest one.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location.. but pricey, with bad attitude”
Reviews.Author: KentishTraveller2008
Reviews.Content: Really good location, just walk out, and you're there.. The Hotel was somewhat tired, but clean. The room was quite cramped, and expensive (was discounted as a late booking which made it acceptable). The breakfast arrangements were not nice, being managed by the local female leader of the Gestapo. Was moaned at for arriving at 10;20, when it said it was open till 10:30. Then at 10:30.. she took the food away. This seemed to be a theme, so, if you might have a tendancy to sleep in a bit.. dont expect a warm reception down there. For that attitude alone, I would not got again, despite all its good qualities.

Reviews.Title: “Good location just off San Marco”
Reviews.Author: Maryaroundtheworld
Reviews.Content: Good location just off San Marco, comfortable and spacious bed, decor attractive in an old-fashoined way, overall good value

Reviews.Title: “fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: faithiebabie
Reviews.Content: we were celebrating our wedding anniversary and the stay was most enjoyable the hotel was in a perfect location to san marco sq, shops and restaurants breakfast was good although dining room looked nothing like picture on website abit disappointing, staff were helpful will definately stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Great location, an old hotel but clean and excellent staff.”
Reviews.Author: discoredhd
Reviews.Content: The staff was extremely friendly, helpful and spoke English like they had all their lives. We didn't have any problems with the hotel, just can't expect fancy four-star U.S. hotel standards. Some of the towels had seen better days, and the decor was old. The bed was comfortable and the location is excellent. One thing to note is that in all of the hotels we stayed in while in Europe the two twin beds were right next to each other, so it's a bit odd for siblings. Also they have a free breakfast, but be prepared to see cheese, meat and bread everywhere you go in Europe for every meal. (My husband loved it, but it wasn't my first choice.)

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Charming rooms.”
Reviews.Author: KCH
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel Panada in August for 3 nights. My room was on level 3. Without a doubt the best feature of the hotel is its location. Just off Piazza San Marco. It is right in the middle of the tourist area. Very accessible to all parts of the island. Made it very easy to get to Basillica in the morning to get in line. (The queue was insane in summer.) Or see St Mark Square at night - highly receommended! A very convenient base for exploring Venice. I did not find noise an issue. The room is a good decent size for Venice hotel. Very clean. Didn't have much of a view but that's easily solved by walking 15 metres to San Marco! Rooms are quite charming - decorated in Venetian style. With Murano glass lights. I have read from a few reviewers that reception staff is a bit rude. Personally I think service is OK but not fantastic. They tend to be very busy and do let their guest stand there waiting for quite a bit. Has elevator in the building but a tight squeeze - so avoid large luggages if possible. Hotel has wifi but a word of warning. It doesn't reach all the way up to 3rd floor. I had to go downstairs to the lobby to use it. I walked upstairs with my laptop and it cut out on level 2. So ask for a lower floor if that is an issue for you. Breakfast was good. Typical of what's offer in Italy hotels of a similar class - toast, tea, pastry, fruit, yogurt etc. Did not use the bar so cannot comment on it. Overall, Antico Panada is a great choice for a few days exploring the art and architecture of Venice. I would definitely consider staying there again. Note: I had a LOT of trouble booking this hotel through HotelClub. They could not confirm the room for a very long time. I ended up booking direct with the hotel website - much simpler and faster. No difference in price offered.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable Hotel in Central Venice”
Reviews.Author: Paloma34
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in the Antico Panada for three nights. The location is great, very easy to find, literally seconds away from St Marks Square and the vaporetto stops at Zaccaria and St Marks. It is situated in what can best be described as an alley, with lots of shops and restaurants in the area. We checked in late and were greeted by a friendly, helpful receptionist. Our room was okay, a little tired maybe, but large enough for two adults to move around in easily. The room had air conditioning and had plenty natural light once you opened the shutters. The bathroom was clean and had a great shower. The walls seemed to be reasonably thin, we couldn't hear voices but could hear anytime the room next door flushed the toilet! Breakfast is a simple continental affair, with pastries, toast, cereal, ham and cheese. It wasn't amazing but its free in a very expensive city, so why complain?! All in all, a perfectly adequate hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Georgie173
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great position for visiting the sights of Venice. Itâ€™s situated between St Marks Square and The Pont Vehicio, both a short walk. My advice would be to check very carefully on a map of Venice exactly the location of the hotel before you go as you really do need to know what direction to take off in once you disembark from the vaporetto water bus. The hotel has a very small sign above the front door when you look up the alleyway it is on. It could be easily missed. The hotel itself was very good. We had booked a standard room for three nights but once we arrived we were given a superior room. No one actually told us at the time of checking in. It was only later when chatting to the barman that we realised we had been upgraded at no extra cost. While this was wonderful of them to do this we had booked a smoking room which are restricted to the standard rooms. We didnâ€™t mind really and just had to curtail our â€˜habitâ€™ while in our hotel room. The staff are all very friendly and spoke English with us. The concierge organised for our bags to be delivered to our room by the porter which was wonderful considering the hotel is a bit like a rabbit warren with regard to the corridors. Breakfast was extremely well organised and the ladies who run the place very efficient. It was the usual continental breakfast â€“ cold meats, cheeses, bread, etc. The hotel can organise trips around and about in Venice so do ask if you would like this. We took the vaporetto water bus to Murano which was very enjoyable. We went to see two demonstrations at the glass factories there. The first was free and not very informative. The second one we paid 5 Euros for and it was brilliant. Murano is wonderfully peaceful after the hustle and bustle of Venice. If visiting Venice during high season then I would recommend getting up early at least one morning and walking the streets to see the city come alive before the tourists pour out of their hotels after their breakfasts. Itâ€™s incredible how they move everything about the place. I would also recommend sitting out in St Marco Sq after dinner and relaxing with a few drinks listening to the divine music. It is expensive, (two rounds of drinks = 55 Euros) but the atmosphere truly wonderful. Great place to people watch too! Iâ€™d rather nurse a glass of wine there than sit in a gondola.

Reviews.Title: “Small, Clean, Convient, Happy - Location Excellent :D”
Reviews.Author: Darahgna
Reviews.Content: We arrived late at night and a policeman guided us to the hotel. The porter took us to our room and the reception staff were friendly and quick. We asked for more pillows and got them within 5 minutes. Had a camp bed which was lovely although took up some room. Amazing bath with whirl pool. CNN news on TV. Beware of the safe in the cupboard shelf as the shelf is not fixed and almost hit my dad, we put it on the floor. Simple but good breakfast. Do not go to the surrounding bars as it is very expensive, however the bar next to Mcdonalds is lovely if you want a nice drink and some waiter entertainment. Watch when you open the window in the morning as you look onto the street shops, it provided many giggles. Overall I would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SBenedetto
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Panada Hotel towards the end of June 2009 and the beginning of July 2009. I had an incredible stay here. The staff were courteous, helpful and accomodating. The location was perfect, just off San Marco's square and you were able to get anywhere very quickly. The hotel was more than great, it was clean, quiet and had all the amenities that I required for a great stay. I would not hesitate to stay here again on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Fantasic Hotel !”
Reviews.Author: SegartyFamily
Reviews.Content: Superb location, right in the heart of Venice, 1 minute walk to St Marks Square. Would highly recommend to anyone. The hotel was lovely and clean, the breakfasts were just right with a mix of fruit, cereal, toast, yoghurts etc. All the staff were great, we especially liked all the reception staff who were so friendly and helpful - nothing was too much trouble. Thanks so much for making our first trip to Venice such an enjoyable one !

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem for sure!”
Reviews.Author: ErinBearin
Reviews.Content: The Antico is in a superb location--just off San Marco's square. It boasted large, beautifully decorated rooms, breakfast included--even a free shuttle to a Murano glass factory. It was near many restarants, including a McDonald's (around the corner), and shops as well. The bed was large and comfortable, the bathroom also large and clean, and the hotel concierge very pleasant. The AC worked great! We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Very great - negative reviews here surprised me”
Reviews.Author: britred11
Reviews.Content: Despite all the negative reviews I read here on this hotel I decided to stay there as I was travelling by myself and felt safer and more comfortable staying at a central location. It is true that it is really not that necessary in Venice to be close to the Piazza San Marco, but I did appreciate that. I could take pictures early in the morning without the crowd of tourists etc.etc. Also, I was extremely positively surprised by the high standard of the room (I have the feeling I was in a newly renovated room). Staff was pleasant enough. I enjoyed the breakfast alot as well... I can say that staying at this hotel was definitely a very good choice and I would go back there anytime!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal central location-easy to find from san marco water bus station.”
Reviews.Author: northumbrian_9
Reviews.Content: fantastic 3 night short break not to be missed. only down side( bloody exspensive)

Reviews.Title: “A great Easter holiday!”
Reviews.Author: Timpalicious
Reviews.Content: We spent four days and four nights in Venice and at Antico Panada. Our trip was absolutely lovely. Our room was very sweet with a romantic interior and even though we had no view over any water our window faced a cosy alley where we could lie in the bath and listen to people pass by. The whirlpool in our superior room was wonderful. The breakfast was simple but served it's pupouse. I called on our arrival day and asked for flowers for the room and without any problem they bought flowers and put them in our room for a decent charge. A special thanks to Alex in the reception who was an absolute gentleman!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect location”
Reviews.Author: lornak66
Reviews.Content: recently back from venice and stayed in the panada hotel. This hotel is very central for everything. Situated along an alley just off st marks square. All staff were very friendly and resonably approachable . The rooms were ok, apart from our room,which was on the top floor, had wallpaper peeling off the wall and found an empty bottle of wine at side of bed. The bathroom was very clean and bedlinen and towels were changed everyday. We would defineately stay at this hotel again as it was perfect to get anywhere in venice. It was also very easy to find if you get lost (which could happen alot). Also be prepared for the bell chiming every hour!!!! EVERY HOUR!!! Venice is a wonderful place to be but beware in some cafes, we went to a "cafe blu" where they took full advantage of us not speaking much italian and charged us things we did not recieve. make sure you have plenty of money

Reviews.Title: “Good value, perfect Hotel very close to san Marco”
Reviews.Author: Vinciente
Reviews.Content: We arrived in April. the best time to visit Venice. The hotel is very close to the great San Marco square in the middle of all the shops and restaurants. The staff is very helpfull be you have to be polite. They were very helpfull and understanding. The room no 113 is the best room of the economic class. this room has its own balcony and is situated at the back of the hotel far from the loud and busy streets. the breakfast was simple but good. and also here the staff is very nice and helpfull if you stay polite. very recomended to the tourist who still knows how to get around the italian way of people. it was a lovely stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable and clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kyriacou
Reviews.Content: Just come back from the Panada hotel, which we were there for 4 nights. We found it a very good location, close to Saint Marks square. The room was comfortable with a good bathroom - sheets and towels changed daily. The Breakfast was continental buffet which was nice. The waitresses were very nice and helpful but the reception staff weren't too pleasant!! Also, you can hear the bells from the clock tower chiming hourly. I would recommend this hotel to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, nice hotel, awful reception staff”
Reviews.Author: WestMidsAndy
Reviews.Content: Unhelpful, abrupt reception staff, possibly the worst customer service I've ever received. If you don't like your job or are very unhappy to be there - leave... The porter looked like and behaved like the staff at the entrance to the 'Tower of Terror' in Florida..... A welcome smile? No...... We felt positively uncomfortable passing through reception. I wouldn't stay here again and wouldn't recommend this hotel to friends. The rooms are comfortable, clean and the bathroom good. Clean linen and towels. We couldn't open our window fully due to scaffolding directly outside the window. Breakfast is continental, plenty to eat and good coffee, the Waitresses at breakfast were a very nice contrast to the reception staff, helpful, friendly and did smile. The location of the hotel is excellent just off the main St Marks Square. Overall the reception staff really let this hotel down - I don't believe they know anything about customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Superb!”
Reviews.Author: tockington
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 2 night stay at this hotel. Excellent location. Staff helpful, patient and friendly. We asked for extra pillows and blankets, and they were with us within 5 minets, with a big smile. Breakfast excellent. We could not fault this wonderful hotel, the price is outstanding, and will be recommending it to friends and family. We won't be staying anywhere else ,when we come back to Venice. Excellent, cannot be faulted.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, Great location”
Reviews.Author: mollylaurel
Reviews.Content: Some of the other reviews have been negative about this hotel, but overall the value is exceptional, considering the location. The rooms were of decent size (our double had a good sized bath, and a balcony) and very clean. Staff were friendly and helpful. The breakfast was plentiful - the previous reviewer has obviously not used one of those standard rotary hotel toasters before - and about average for the rating of the hotel. Certainly more than I have had in the past; toast, cereal, cheese and cold meats, tea or coffee. The location is superb - just a few minutes walk from Piazza San Marco - though it was a little hard to find, as the street it's on is very tiny. A few hours in Venice though, and you become used to these tiny ally ways. Overall, I would recommend this hotel as great value for money; we stayed 4 nights and have no complaints, aside from the prices in the bar. P.S. a previous reviewer mentioned not reading about cover charges and high prices - they obviously hadn't read very much about Venice. Almost all restaurants have cover charges if you want to sit, especially around Piazza San Marco and other tourist hot spots. Service charges are usually about 12% on top of your bill - this is standard. Venice is an "enclave of luxury" - expect to pay high prices!

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the cover/service charge in ALL Venice restaurants”
Reviews.Author: orangemann
Reviews.Content: The first thing that hit me when we walked into this hotel was the smell. A horrible smell that was all over the hotel even in the rooms. The reception staff ,with one exception, were rude and unhelpful. The room was tiny. But the worst of all was the breakfast. Choice of 2 cereals, watered down juice, a toaster that only heated the bread and didn't brown it. Terrible just terrible. The worst breakfast offering I have ever come across. Yes the location was perfect 30 seconds form St Marks square. But beware eating or drinking in or around the square. â‚¬8.50 for a can of Coke and the same for a coffee... absolute rip-off. In all the reviews I have read on Venice I have not come across the rip off culture of the cover charge and the service charge in ALL restaurants. This can add 20-25 % to any bill. A scandal that Venice should be ashamed of. What is the cover charge for? Nobody could tell me. The impression I got all round was get as much money from the tourist without giving a decent product or sevice in return.

Reviews.Title: “New Year's Eve Stay”
Reviews.Author: JaceChel
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from an overnight stay in Venice. Celebrating New Year's in Venice is unforgettable. Especially our stay at the Hotel Panada. The hotel is literally steps from the San Marco Sq. It is very easy to find. Go under the clock arch tower, make the first right, and the next left...You'll see the red lighted sign over the entry door. Our room was in a separate building and is a crazy maze trying to get to it while inside...Our room was very comfortable. Venetian style decor and carpeted room. Our balcony looked over the busy walkway and we were right over the McDonald's entry. Very nice to hear the crowd, and very quiet when the window is shut. Very clean room. I must have got a good room because the walls had no huge damage, heat worked, nice lighting. Large bed (2 twin beds together). Bathroom had a jacuzzi tub, marble walls, large mirror. Breakfast is usual, continental styel, breads, meats, cheese, yogurt, juice, coffee...It was ok. After we checked out (11:00am), we got to leave our luggage at the hotel and walk around for the whole day. You're luggage is left under the stairs so make sure you take out an valuables. There were a lot of luggages when we left our stuff. Not bad!! Hotel staff were very friendly. We would go back to Panada! Recommend to everyone

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel, good location, value for money”
Reviews.Author: constanttraveller65
Reviews.Content: just wanted to say ive just come back from a 4 night break at the hotel and it was fantastic!!!! brilliant location just off san marks square. lovely staff - room very clean, bed linen changed everyday with fresh towels. breakfast was fine also, not much choice but it was included in the price anyway. will be going back next year, xx

Reviews.Title: “The dirtiest Hotel In Venice.”
Reviews.Author: sabre47
Reviews.Content: If you want a Hotel that has the rudest staff. Dirtiest rooms I have ever seen, believe me, I live in Dar es Salaam, Tanzania and have seen some really poor hotels but NEVER this dirty and patchy. The room we stayed in was at the back of the hotel up about 3 very weird flights of stairs. It was a room that they seem to keep for emergencies only. The air conditioner 'spewed' out really 'foul' air and never got anywhere near cool let alone cold. The breakfast was like an army canteen 'hurry up and eat & get out of here' was the attitude of the staff. The toaster did not function properly even after runing the bread thru it at least 4 times we only got very hard pale bread and not toast. The orange juice was watered down concenterate, not fresh as advertised. There was no alternative juice so if you could not drink orange juice you had to have water. The coffee was like reboiled old well water and really terrible. For a country that prides itself on excellent coffee this was really bad. The rest of the meal was so awful we eventually ended up going out for breakfast. WE WILL NEVER STAY IN THIS DISGUSTING HOTEL AGAIN AND WILL NOT RECOMMEND IT TO ANYONE. We have already given our thoughts out to other peple we met on the cruise ship. Lots of negative advertising going around from our side, especially here in Tanzania, in the UK & South Africa. Please people do not waste your precious holiday time and money on this awful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lucky reassignment from nearby hotel”
Reviews.Author: gisaster25
Reviews.Content: Through Venere.com I'd booked a double room with shared bathroom at the 2-star Hotel Citta di Milano (San Marco 590 - Campiello San Zulian - Corte Lucatello) for 80 euros/night for April 17-20, 2007. Upon arrival at Citta di Milano, however, I found a note stuck on the door saying that the hotel was closed for emergency renovations and guests had been reassigned to nearby hotels. (Gee, thanks for the advance notice!) Another note said I was reassigned to the Hotel Antico Panada about 2 minutes away. Arriving in their reception area, I was worried I'd be charged a higher rate to stay at this 3-star hotel, which is 30 seconds from Piazza San Marco, but I guess Citta di Milano had an arrangement with them where I still paid only 80 euros/night but got a triple room (one double bed and one twin) with ensuite bathroom and breakfast included! The room was large, nicely furnished, with three windows opening onto a quiet internal yard, a safe, TV, and A/C, and spotlessly clean. The breakfast was surprisingly comprehensive for Italy: coffee, OJ, pastries and rolls, cold cereal, yogurt, jams, cheese and cold cuts. What a lucky turn of events that I could spend 3 nights at Hotel Panada for such a bargain! Perhaps I should send Hotel Citta di Milano a thank you letter...

Reviews.Title: “Panada is great”
Reviews.Author: DanSimmo
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay in Hotel Panada. The Hotel is really close to Plaza San Marco and right in the middle of Venice's tourist shopping district. Our room was a good size (it was a triple) and all the fittings were in good order. The room ha lovely big windows that opoened onto the world's smallest balcony. Panada seems to be two or three hotels strung together. So the trip to out room involved going up, across, down, across, up. But once we got there it was worth it as the room looked out onto a nice little street. Some of the rooms we passed would probably not be so great. Part of the hotel is above the 'kitchen' of the local McDonalds. So smelled like cheeseburger. It's not near any canals, so don't expect to look out the window at whistling gondaliers! There's comments that the hotel is not easy to find. Well, nothing is in Venice! In fact it's just a 100m or so off the back corner of Plaza San Marco (behind the basilica). I'd advise finding the location first in detail (before you leave home) to make it less stressful.

Reviews.Title: “no no no”
Reviews.Author: KlausR
Reviews.Content: Four words: Do not stay here. I stayed 2 days here, in one of their standard rooms. You need quality to attain 3 stars, and here there is none. This hotel shares a back courtyard with the only McDonalds i Venice, so the smell of it was permeating every corridor. The wallpaper was peeling, and the view was 5 feet to the brick building across (although that is to be expected in downtown Venice). But the most terrible thing was the size of the room: 1 double bed, pushed into a corner, and 2 feet of space to the walls around it. Ensuite bathroom, yes. But at 5 by 5 feet, it was all showercurtains. I can not call it a room. The included breakfast was a joke. Self-toasting with a selection of 3 types of saussage, cornflakes and coffee/tea. It's all you need to survive until lunch. But only just. I would not stay here, not even if they payed me the rates they are charging. Granted: it was clean. Granted: it is located less than 100 yeards from St. Markus Square. But that is all they've got. I recommend: Spend more money, and get a waterfront hotel. There are plenty.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, but that's about it”
Reviews.Author: fleurage
Reviews.Content: Well, first of all it's not that easy to find it! Second, our room was not in the hotel and we had to walk for 5 minutes to get into the room which was located in another(scary) building. TV was not working as well as there was no internet connection, which was advertised. There is an internet available for 3 euros/30 minutes in the business office of the hotel. Scanty breakfast served in the "main" building, too many people in those tiny rooms with low ceilings. Pro's- room was big and clean, another great thing was that is has a huge jacussi bath that I really needed after wondering the streets.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: Scottraveller6
Reviews.Content: Make sure before arriving in venice that you have taken note of directions to hotel, as it is up a tiny side street. The big plus about this hotel is location location location, a mere two min walk and you are standing in st marks square. Hotel was ok, quite dated on arrival we found staff ok but not overally cheerful. The lift is tiny, rooms were ok wallpaper was patched in few areas but apart from that it was ok. Furniture was very classic venice decor. Antique looking chairs, bed and tables. Shower was good but seemed to leak onto the floor. Hotel was quiet and clean. I would recommend this hotel to someone who doesnt expect anymore than a 3 star hotel, the hotel was average decor, but was very clean and in a fantastic location.(also great aircon) Tip; venice is expensive, walk to the end of the street and try the fresh baked large pizzas slices for 2 euros, it was the best pizza ive ever tasted, also try the the many favours of ice cream,it delicious! Gondola rides are 100 euros so start saving!! Be careful by staff who say you can sit and eat on the great canal, some will add a charge for this.

Reviews.Title: “Good news/bad news!”
Reviews.Author: bainso
Reviews.Content: Good news: The Antico Panada hotel is in a good location for sightseeing very near St. Mark's Square. There are lots of shops & restaurants nearby. The room we were assigned to on the 3rd floor was larger than expected with a nice decent-sized bathroom. There was a large wardrobe with an in-room safe. The air conditioner worked great. It was very warm while we were in Venice so that was very much appreciated. The included breakfast although not extensive helped since we missed getting there before 10:30 on a couple of occasions & it cost us 11 euro for 2 cafe lattes & 2 pastries. With the exchange rate that was expensive! The women working in the breakfast room were quick to bring us coffee & tea & to offer us refills. The hotel being so close to a number of sights was a plus since we stopped by the room several times to use the bathroom or to get a jacket. Bad news: The room was tired & worn & in need of an upgrade. The blanket on the bed looked dirty & we were glad there was a sheet in between. In the bathroom when we arrived were 2 shampoos & 2 small bars of soap. There was a tri-fold screen for the shower that we found difficult to use w/out getting the floor wet. There is a blow dryer, but you could not adjust it. I left a tip for housekeeping, but for the next 2 days the shampoo, soap, toilet paper & plastic cups were not replaced even though there was only a sliver of soap left in the tub & on the sink. I finally had to go down to the front desk to ask for the above items. There is no clock in the room, but the hotel does provide wake-up calls. The TV was attached to the wall, but was very high up. There was 1 English channel--CNN. The breakfast room was small & hot. The tiny bar was cute. There is a sitting room off the lobby. The elevator was slow & very small. The area around the hotel is busy & it can be noisy, but that did not bother us. The front desk offered to book a gondola ride for us for 40 euro each, but we would have to share it with 4 other people so we opted to go on our own. They offered to include a trip to Murano with the gondola ride. They will also make theatre & restaurant reservations. The staff was friendly & helpful. There were men painting around the hotel so they are trying to keep it up.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LDiamond
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Clean, comfortable but most importantly in a great location. You are within walking distance of everything. From previous reviews it sounds like a room lottery as we stayed in 274 & didn't hear the bells. In fact our room was nicely decorated & not at all tired looking. Breakfast was basic & i would suggest when eating out at lunch or evening avoid the restaurants in the immediate area as they are tourist traps, bad food & bad value. There are however some excellent restaurants tucked away in the side streets.

Reviews.Title: “The worn out Antico Panada”
Reviews.Author: formershrink
Reviews.Content: If I didn't know better, I'd say I stayed at a different Antico Panada from previous reviewers, since the room at the hotel I stayed at was quite run-down: numerous wallpaper holes; stained walls and floor; masking tape from painting around the door; etc. The staff appeared to have long ago tired of offering hospitality to guests but, fortunately, were also too tired to be rude. There simply is no reason to stay at the Panada. There is no need to be a 45-second walk from Piazza San Marco. The hotel is in the tourist ghetto and 25 feet from McDonald's. Venice has so many charming places to stay. This just wasn't nice enough.

Reviews.Title: “The Bells!”
Reviews.Author: Brum2
Reviews.Content: Booked the rooms through Traveleurope for 130 euros a night. Found the hotel no problem after arriving late at night. Check in was speedy and efficient and the room was just what I expected - slightly tired but clean and tidy. The hotel is in a superb location and St Marks square is a matter of seconds away. The hotels location might, however, be it's downfall! You are so close to the square that as the previous reviewer said you get woken up on the hour every hour by the Bells! We were absolutely shattered after our trip - partly due to all the walking but mostly due to not being able to get a good nights sleep. In short if you are a heavy sleeper you could not choose a better value for money hotel, however, if you aren't think twice about this one. It's a real shame because it's nothing that some decent double glazing couldn't rectify.

Reviews.Title: “great location!!!”
Reviews.Author: dublingirl23
Reviews.Content: spent two nights here in the beginning of march, could not fault the hotel on its cleanliness or helpfulness of staff. rooms:- the first room we were given was furnished to a high standard, marble bathrooms etc but the size of the room was unacceptable, my partner and i could not walk in the room at the same time. one would have to sit on the bed. The door of the bathroom opened out almost onto the bed. staff were great we asked for a replacement room and was given one immediately., the 2nd room wasnot of such a high standard was more of a ventian style with murano style lights etc, but importantly was bigger, and had a great view. So much to do in Vencie, we fould we spent very little time in the hotel. please note contstruction work was occuring on some corridors during our stay, did not interfere with our sleeping though. Location was absolutly fantastic, couldnt have asked for anything better, do advise to bring a map, can be quite confusing at the beginning. would recommend hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Bellissimo !”
Reviews.Author: Holiday_Monkeys
Reviews.Content: Cracking little hotel ! Ideally situated near St Marks Square. Close to everything. We had no problems finding the hotel. The staff there are very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was the usual continental,but ok to stock up on before going out. Rooms are small but thats what you expect in Venice where there is not much land avaliable !! Definately recommend this hotel to anyone. Mcdonalds is next door if you need a cheap bite to eat or drink !

Reviews.Title: “Nice Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: happytraveller0200
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a week, and it was quite nice. The hotel was a bit hard to find, because it is located on a narrow street between buildings.The location was great, a few minutes away from St.Mark's square. The staff was very friendly and helpful, although the waitresses did not speak English that well. The breakfast was simple, but the waitresses were friendly. The rooms are all different, both in size and in decoration, so it really depends on what they give you. Our room was nice, well furnished, and in typical Venetian style. The bathrooms were all clean and modern. The internet service was very cheap, and even accessible from the rooms. However, there was only one elevator and it was very small, maximum 4 people. This hotel is good and recommendable to tourists willing to stay in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: michSF
Reviews.Content: This hotel's location right off of Piazza San Marco was excellent. The rooms are decorated with lovely old hand-painted furniture and Murano chandeliers. Tiny balconies outside the windows allowed a breath of fresh air when desired. The bathroom, though quite small, was separated from the room by an entry alcove, which made the room feel larger than it really was. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. FYI: At breakfast, if you order an espresso drink, you only get one - additional requests mean you'll be charged for them. Opt for the coffee with milk if you're planning on drinking more than one cup.

Reviews.Title: “Fab location”
Reviews.Author: Scorptats
Reviews.Content: just came back from the Panada Hotel. Stayed for 4 nts. arrived late and we were given a superior room which was fantastic! the hotel has 2 superior rooms in the hotel and 2 others across the alley in a separate building which was a bit strange but worth it when we saw the room! huge room with antique furniture large bed, big windows, black out blinds, huge wardrobe with safe and mini-bar. the bathroom was a bit small but you can understand that they cant renovate much. The breakfast was a little disapointing compared to other breakfasts offered in other 3 star european hotels. tea/coffee/hot chocolate, natural yogurt, 2 types of cereal, cheese,ham and condiments. there wasnt much that you could take away which would have been handy as it is an expensive city. The main thing that we took away, was the location of this hotel! you are steps away from St.Marks which we found was where you base yourself from. it was great to be able to go back to hotel 2 even 3 times during the day to freshen up, change shoes etc!! Has a fantasitc time in vencie but i would recommend people pay for the superior room as a couple we spoke to said that the standard rooms are quite small. Overall a good 3* star in the absolute heart of venice!!

Reviews.Title: “Great 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: miksolo
Reviews.Content: Great location (just behind San Marco square) and easy to find. Helpful staff. Very charming room and very clean and modern bathroom. Highly recommended hotel and good value for money. Small minuses: certain rooms are not always easy to find because of the structure of the hotel. The lift works even if it is very slow. The hotel is between buildings so the view from our room was not so great. Breakfast had limited choice.

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: octoberitaly
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. Not everyone spoke fluent English, but enough to get by( well actually just the night person was not fluent, but he got us what we needed and unfortunately my Italian is limited to quanto costo). Central to St Marks, clean, comfortable. Nice breakfast with croissants and coffee and juice and cheese and prosciuttio. I would definitely stay here again. They even had extra toothbrushes in our bathroom, a nice touch. Internet available for a low fee. I stayed here for free with thank you points from my bank, but would have paid full price. A tiny bit noisy at night but died down by 11 pm. The beds were more comfortable than most! Stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: iannellid
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here for 3 nights. It was a wonderful little hotel right behind St. Mark's. Room was small but beautiful. Bathroom had a jacuzzi and a great shower. Have nothing bad to say about the place - highly recommend it for someone who is staying in Venice for a short period of time and wants to be right there. Streets around there very busy at night and on the weekend. Hotel could use maps to your room - takes a bit of practice to find your room and then find your way back to the front desk. But loved it there....

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Pelikan
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in May '06 for my honeymoon for 4 nights. The hotel is clean, charasmatic and well-appointed though not super-luxurious and a little worn in places. It is a) an old hotel and b) in the middle of a very compact city therefore it is unrealistic to expect huge motel-sized bedrooms. Our room was just fine, and had a nice outlook onto the alley beneath, great for people watching and snooping on those passing by! Breakfast was OK rather than great. Location is ideal, just off St Marks which is well-posted through-out the city so it was always easy to get back after a days exploring. Would love to come back though off season to experience an emptier city.

Reviews.Title: “loved venice”
Reviews.Author: DAndrews
