Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 3 night stay at this hotel which I found to be above average for its star rating. The room was very clean and tidy with fresh linen and towels every day. The hotel staff and desk manager were extremely pleasant and helpful at all times, an experience not always found abroad. The breakfast was certainly better than what is on offer in Rome and the staff were extremely pleasant, topping up your coffee cup regularly. The location for this hotel is superb being less than 3 minutes off of St Marks square and is easy to find which is important if you arrive late at night as we did. After the first day you will appreciate how central the hotel is after seeing how some people are having problems finding other hotels and having to get water taxis to get there. The hotel is situated in narrow streets and it is fair to say that there isnâ€™t much of a view from the window but the air conditioning made up for this. The antico panada is well worth the price on location alone, something that I have experienced in many countries, location is very important on short trips to maximise your site seeing time. A couple of tips for visiting Venice. Make sure you have a 1 Euro coin for a trolley at the airport if you catch the waterbus as itâ€™s a 10 minute walk from the arrival lounge. Eating out is very expensive and poor value for money, better off grabbing a piece of pizza and a drink from a cafÃ©, if you go for a meal in a restaurant you will probably have the same and pay at least twice as much. Get out and about early as it gets incredibly busy in the afternoon especially if there are cruise liners around. And most important make sure you get a good map, you will still get lost at times but you can always refer to the map.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: S0undbite
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights here in July. The location is excellent, a few minutes from St. Mark's Square. Rooms (one twin and one single) were a little small but perfectly adequate. My only complaint was that the air conditioning was not very effective. We found the staff to be perfectly friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “If you want a Happy Meal, stay here.”
Reviews.Author: nonstop_7
Reviews.Content: Our travel agent booked this hotel for the last two nights of our trip to Italy. What a disappointment. For $400 a night we felt it was grossly over-rated. It was close to St. Mark's Square, however, we did not know that it was over McDonald's Restaurant....yes, the McDonalds straight out the USA, grease and all. Our room must have been over the kitchen because the smell of grease was overpowering. The view out our window was an alley with dumpsters below and the building across from us, about ten feet away, was boarded up. The pigeons liked perching on the window sill and didn't seem to mind the exposed pipes that were also part of our disappointing view. The front desk people acted like they needed a vacation themselves. They probably have a lot of unhappy travelers to deal with. For the price we paid, we could have done much better.

Reviews.Title: “So central!”
Reviews.Author: Jetsettertas
Reviews.Content: We had been tripping all through Europe and this place was outstanding for its star rating. 1 minute walk from central St. Marco square! VERY helpful reception staff. Room decor was not my style. Large bathroom and bed. Fresh sheets everyday! Breakfast was like most other hotels just on a bigger scale. I would be very happy to stay here again. Just beware there is a rest. called De Celio to the right down the ally and then to the left which serves Tang - orange falvoured juice to you for 6 Euro dispite other rest on the island serving fresh OJ for the same amount. It food was not very good either.

Reviews.Title: “What a hole!!!”
Reviews.Author: grantcarter64
Reviews.Content: Very Bad experience!!! booked for 3 nights for my 30th Birthday and stayed just 1. Couldnt open the room door as the bed was in the way!! 2 singles pushed together for the advertised double room. Breakfast room was like dining in a sauna!! Unhelpful staff capped off a truely depressing experience. Pay just 25 euros more and stay in a nice 4 star, its more than worth it and will help you enjoy the venice experience

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: mf012e
Reviews.Content: Awesome location. Tucked away just behind St Marks square down a little alley. Great value, service was good, breakfast okay. Best pizza in Venice right down the alley. Coming out of hotel, go left and the pizzeria will be on your right(maybe 30-50ft). Cheap for Venice too!!

Reviews.Title: “absolutely fantastic”
Reviews.Author: missclare
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a real find absolutely fantastic value and locatin is brilliant we arrived at night and had no problem in finding the hotel once we got there we were amazed we payed 70 a night and what we got for that was fantastic. the bedroom was beautiful with venetian sty;ing the bathroom had a jacussi and we even had our own private sitting room amazing,,,all for 70 euro we felt like royalty the service is very good & friendly breakfast was also good and preety big we had a mini bar bathrobes & towles 7 toilitries all supplied and replaced every day with fresh ones room was spotless couldnt recommend it enough it really added to our stay in venice we wernt expecting much for what we paid also the street its on really is beautiful and captures the essense of venice with some great little shops the restruants nearby are v pricy which we found out all in all an outstanding 10/10 for the hotel made our holiday for 4 days i felt like royalty that is not an exageration 70 euros unbelievable

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: aussiegreg
Reviews.Content: my wife and i stayed here recently, the location to st. marks square is brilliant, less that 100 metres and there lays the problem, you can here the bells toll, the crowds gather, the tourists scream at the pigeons and so fourth. the room was just outstanding, king size bed that was rock hard as where the pillows (if thats your thing then great, not mine) our room had a spa bath which at the end of along day walking around was bliss. the breakfast was adequite but thats it. the staff where helpful but not friendly, very close to everything, great gelati down the street. woth looking at if your a sound sleeper.

Reviews.Title: “Antico Panada,amazing tthree star hotel in the heart of Venice”
Reviews.Author: DidBG
Reviews.Content: We went to Venice on 24th Dec 2006 and stayed for three nights in a lovely hotel Antico Panada,*** rated in the heart of Venice 2 min from Piazza San Marco. The hotel rooms were nicely decorated and we were offered to have our room changed for a newly, nicely decorated apartment belonging to the hotel, which was round the corner. The service was great for three star hotel, breakfast was very nice too, including buffet plus a very polite service from the staff. the location of the hotel is perfect,very close to all the main attractions in a very beautiful part of romantic Venice. We were very pleased from our stay there, there was cable tv, the room was decorated in a venetian style and very warm, as the nights there were quite cold compared from the sunny days. Restaurants around the hotel are a bit pricy, but one can easily find a nice place to have dinner, apart from u have to be careful of the service and cover charge in the most of the restaurants, so u don't get surprised. We had a lovely Christmas day in Venice,was very quiet and relaxing,pleasant for walks round the canals and visiting the amazing Gothic and Renaissance churches with beautiful facades and wealthy interiors. Venice is a beautiful, romantic city and is worth visiting at least once in a life time. Daniela and Ves

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: MarkJules
Reviews.Content: The Hotel The Panada is a friendly, clean and tidy hotel with a minutes walk from St Marks Square. The staff were very welcoming on the front desk and the presentation of the hotel was spot on. We booked a room through Expedia, which appeared to be a standard room, but the facilities were more than adequate for the price of around Â£45 per night. The room was big enough and offered complimentary toiletries too. The Area The Panada is situated in an ideal location, up a narrow street and within a stones throw from St Marks Square. We had no problems finding the hotel, but Venice is a maze of small, narrow streets, if you get lost, find the Square and head back from there. Venice This was our second trip to Venice and we would recommend anyone to go. We spent Christmas here two years ago and returned this time, a week before Xmas. It is a magical time of year, with plenty happening, but itâ€™s not too busy (as mentioned in other reviews). The best ways to see Venice is by foot and by vaporetta. Doges Palace, St Marks Basilica and St Marks Campanile are a must. Visit the island of Murano too, there is so much to do. Hopefully this review is helpful and if you are about to visit Venice for the first time, have a wonderful time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, good value”
Reviews.Author: Amanda30
Reviews.Content: For the price this was a good find. The location is excellent - right next to St Mark's Square. The room and bathroom were clean and there were a number of thoughtful touches, such as toothbrush kits, razor and sewing kit. The breakfast was basic but filling and the staff friendly. One word of warning though - the hotel is very hot, even with the heating turned off in the room, and in December! Plus, when we opened the window the room filled with mosquitos and we were bitten to bits.

Reviews.Title: “Central location, quiet hotel”
Reviews.Author: Traveler2005
Reviews.Content: We sratyed at the hotel the week of October 14 for 5 nights. The hotel is VERY centrally located - less than 100 feet from San Marco - on a tiny street about three feet wide. Our room (268) had a king size bed, a window onto an air shaft, and was compact but with everything we needed, plus a beautiful marble bathroom with a jacuzzi. The window gave minimal light, which we didn't care about because we only slept there, and the hotel was the quietest we have experienced in Italy. The staff was friendly and helpful, athough breakfast was a bit on the basic side. If you want to stay in the center of the action, it is hard to imagine a better choice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Selti
Reviews.Content: Hotel is pretty close to San Marcos square. We stayed there three nights and enjoyed the hotel pretty much. The rooms were big and though the hotel is located in a small street near the square (3-4 minutes walk) it was quiet. The bathroom had a bath, not just a shower. We were happily surprised.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tv_eye
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a three-night stay at the Panada. The hotel is in a perfect location - a two-minute walk from the Piazza San Marco (though the bells did not keep us awake). Venice is an extremely expensive city, and this hotel - located where it is - is excellent value for money. It might not be what American tourists expect of a three-star hotel, but that would be true virtually anywhere in Europe. Based on some of the reviews below, I was extremely pleasantly surprised: the staff was excellent, helpful and friendly; the rooms we had were far from tiny, had all amenities you'd expect (plus a few nice extras, like toothbrush and toothpaste) and, most importanly, it was spotless; the breakfast was a typical continental affair (tip: after 9.30 is less crowded); and, as already stated, the location can't be topped. I would happily recommend this hotel to other travellers who understand the difference between a 3-star hotel in any European city as opposed to a 3-star in America.

Reviews.Title: “Small, dark and depressing”
Reviews.Author: Sobaka
Reviews.Content: We stayed there three nights in early August. The only good thing about this hotel is its proximity to St. Marco squire. It is literally minutes away from it. Everything else is very disappointing. Nothing in hotel looks like pictures on their site that are quite misleading. As I understand, they have a couple of new and larger room in adjacent building and that is what they picture on their site. Reality is very far from it. Our room was extremely small and Spartan. There were 3 of us â€“ my husband, I and our 19-year old daughter so we had queen and single beds. And that was it â€“ there was no room for anything else including our suitcases (and we traveled very light!). In order to get anything from the suitcase we had to put it on our bed. Bathroom was very tiny with shower that had some kind of a strange folding barrier that made it very difficult to get into the shower and leaked onto the flow every time we took a shower. Our room was also very dark. Both room and bathroom windows had shutters over them all the time and there was very little of artificial light. Therefore, our room was very depressing tiny dark dungeon with very low sealing and tired dÃ©cor. The last thing that completely stressed me out was that the last night we came to our room my nightgown was gone. We had â€˜do not disturbâ€™ sign on our door but it was completely ignored. I talked to the front desk, and they promised to check with their cleaning people in a morning. In a morning when I spoke to a new front desk person, I had to repeat my story again and again I was given a promise to check. At night when we were leaving hotel, I asked about my gown again and was told that if my gown was light (what it was), it is easy to mistake it for the bed linen. They promised to check again and asked for my address so they can send it to me when they find it. Month and a half later I am still waiting for my favorite nightgown. There was no apology or remorse from hotel personal. I would not stay in this hotel nor would I recommend it to others. I guess that with two good rooms and many not so good the chances of getting lucky are too low for a gamble.

Reviews.Title: “Simple hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: terabytes
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very conveniently located just one block away from St Marks place. It's the perfect "base" for a tour of Venice. Rooms are OK, although they are quite small, and furnitures and decoration show some sign of age (+fuzzy TV). On the contrary, the bathroom was brand new. Windows are on two narrow streets, depending of which side is your room, so you won't have any view. It seems that one street is noisier than the other, as, contrary to what other reviewers say, we weren't bothered by the noise at night with the windows open at the 2nd floor. Yes, the bells of St Marks' place can be heard but only, apparently, up to midnight and starting again at 7, so it does not really bother. The breakfast room is quite small and you are likely to have some waiting to get a table in the morning rush hours, but quality is OK. Staff is friendly. At your arrival, the groom would do a lot to get his tip (although our room was just upstairs, he brought us into the elevator and, staying outside, pushed the floor button for us, then he took the stairs to lead us to our rooms). On the negative side: if you ask to let your luggage at the hotel (in case of an early arrival before rooms are ready of after check-out), they are just left unattended in the lobby, instead of being stored in a safe place. Would come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from here, it's horrible”
Reviews.Author: Kimara
Reviews.Content: First of all, the hotel really doesn't have any pictures about it's frame. Don't trust those pics, honestly speaking that building in the picture is the Palace of Dolce. Second thing to be disappointed, our room didn't have even a hint of that 18th century feeling or interior. Rathole i'd say. Bathroom was nasty and dark closet with green 70's walls. I can't be sure when the bathtube had been cleaned well last time (smelled a little urin). Breakfast was not any kind of fabulous, rarely admittable. Hotel rates itself to three star upper turist- or mid-class. I doubt if it really is even **- level. In this case I wouldn't talk about air-condition - the heat kept us awake almost all night. Totally disappointment. Instead of this I recommend rather choose some hotel for example in Lido-area. That looked more that imaginated romantic and beautiful Venice I was looking for. Here are a few photos with to make your own opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Poor, poor, poor”
Reviews.Author: RGNJ
Reviews.Content: Avoid this place, it was an all around nightname. Let's start with the room, which included peeling walls, a broken safe, uncomfortable bed, broken air conditioner and dead bugs (killed on the wall and ceiling) just to mention a very of the lowlights. The rooms are small, which is understandable for Venice, but the bathroom did not meet expectations. The front desk staff was poor. A simple request for towels and extra bedding was denied. Instead the staffer said it was too late for the request and it would arrive in the morning. It never arrived. Prior to arriving we also requested a high level room to reduce the noise from the passing crowds, but we never got it. Though a higher level room was available the next day, they never followed through with our request. I attempted to purchase tickets at the frontdesk for the watertaxi ride to the airport, but was told they don't sell tickets. The sign just two feet from the man's head clearly indicated differently "Tickets Sold Here, No Commissions". He seem disinterested in helping, despite being asked by us several times for directions to the watertaxi location. A positive spot was the bellman, who was very helpful in getting our bags to our room. The breakfast was horrible. The same minimal offering every morning. The only highlight was the hot drinks, they were good. The staff was mediocre, at best. I also caution the advice of others who suggested the location was ideal. Sure, its close to San Marco, but its tucked in a very narrow path way that is constantly crowded from 8am to mid-night. It was difficult to getting luggage thru. Though I visited during the mid-to-high season, I would recommend searching another Venice district. The meal service in the San Marco area is very overpriced, and doesn't match the quality found in the other Venice districts. You can also find nicer hotels, at better prices, outside of the San Marco area. If you stay here and regret it, you can't say you weren't warned. Note: The Panada does have another location, which I believe it shares with other hotel vendors. In speaking with a couple who stayed there, the Panada has a few rooms (bigger in size) and they are nicer. Be aware that some of the opinions expressed on this board might be referencing the "other" Panada location that is not attached to the main hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Avois this hotel”
Reviews.Author: shakergrandma
Reviews.Content: The Antico Panada hotel is one to be avoided. We were so disappointed in our room. It was very worn and it smelled horribly. We were able to upgrade to a â€œnicerâ€� room, for an addition $50. and really it wasnâ€™t much better. The bathroom was so small that it was hard to use. I would be very careful before booking a room in Venice. This would be the time to really think about springing for that 5 star hotel. Yes, the location was good, but almost any location would be good in Venice. Donâ€™t trust the pictures on the internet.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, location, staff and price!”
Reviews.Author: Janie01
Reviews.Content: Hotel Panada was GREAT! Everything was perfect from registration through checkout. The front desk staff were extremely kind and helpful. Our room was large, with a very nice bathroom that had been recently updated with marble and new fixtures. Extras in the bathroom included individually boxed toothbrush/ toothpaste sets and razors. The complimentary breakfast buffet was nice. The church bells were never a bother, nor was street noise. The location is excellent. We would highly recommend Hotel Panada for quality and value! We hope to visit again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value find in the heart of Venice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a four night stay at the Panada Antico Hotel. The Staff were extremely friendly and they were happy to help with any enquiries including sorting out a breakfast bag for us to take to the airport because of our early departure time. The rooms were clean and comfortable with towels, sheets etc changed daily. Went with Parents in their late 70's and the location of the Hotel, the lift access to rooms and staff help with luggage etc meant we had no problems If you are looking for a clean and good value Hotel in the heart of Venice then this is ideal. I agree with a previous reviewer that the rush for breakfast can lead to a wait for a table, however we only experienced this between 9.00 and 9.30am. I'd also recommend checking that your room is on the side of the hotel. We didn't experience any problem with noise but it might be a different story if your room faces on to the main thoroughfare. As a previous reviewer noted you can't be in the middle of Venice and not hear the bells strike. We only noticed the midnight bell on one night and the 7am bell one morning. This is our third trip to Venice and I would be happy to return to stay at the Panada Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Cannot recommend this hotel highly enough. Our room was amazing, even had a Jacuzzi and a roof terrace. The staff were polite, friendly, helpful and spoke good English. The continental breakfast was good and the whole hotel was superbly clean and comfortable. The location could not be better, just 2 mins from St.Marks square. The only thing which some people might find troublesome was the fact that St.Marks rang the church bell at midnight, it woke us every night but it was worth putting up with to be so near St.Marks square and the Grand Canal. Its possible to carry suit cases to the hotel from the canal stop where the airpot boat stops without having to cross bridges and if you are prepared to pay highly there are water taxi's which stop close to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Intimateescape
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just came back from this hotel. When we checked in we were asked to turn our passports in and left there. We both felt not comfortable to leave them behind so we told them to wait while they process. One staff got upset immediately and started to say something in Italian. We did not care about him and waited until the other staff finished the process. He held gruches until we checked out. Another young fat staff at the reception was awful. I came up to him for the help for our return pick-up arrangement, first thing he asked was "Are you staying here?". If I say no, he will not give me a help? His English ability was not good enough to under what I said or asked, so I repeated the same question to just make sure. He got more and more upset and started screamed at me repeatedly in angry voice and ignored me for other customer. How can he keep the job at the reception to solve the problems and troubles with this attitude. I used to work at the travel agency desk myself, but never did treat my customer like this. We really need help from the reception especialy we are in overseas. I admire the help from the reception at the Hotel Londra Palace with smile when we shortly arrived Venice.. They never even asked the stupid question he did. This hotel reception staffs have an attitude. Also the breakfast was just disappointing. Waitress will not hesitate to tell you to wait at the lobby when they do not want you to sit at the table for four for just one.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, near everything!”
Reviews.Author: debc58
Reviews.Content: Great location, 1.5 "blocks" from Piazza San Marco--good for dropping in and out during the day. Have been to Venice 3 times, and this hotel was average. Stayed 5 nights this time around, booked online as part of a package. We were there during Carnivale, so it was quite noisy late into the early morning hours most nights. Hotel staff did call us at 12:30 PM to ask us to leave the room so they could clean--even though we had a "do not disturb sign" on the door. We had been out very late, and we were still recovering from jet-lag. We were not amused. That being said, we would stay there again. Breakfast was the usual continental style, with great coffee and friendly staff. Rooms are small, but clean. Who goes to Venice to spend very long in the hotel room anyways?

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: misslassie
Reviews.Content: We only stayed for two nights but fell in love with Venice and the Antico Panada. The location was superb and our twin room was lovely and spacious. Breakfast was a terrific start to the morning and the ladies were so lovely and friendly! We had a marvellous time and would definitley stay there again! We booked directly through the hotel to get the best price

Reviews.Title: “A well located hotel in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: LNCG
Reviews.Content: We have booked this hotel from a website and we must say that the price for this season were not expensive for a city as Venice! It was around 70% above the regular price. That's why we have decided to book a Junior suite... -The location is wonderful because the St Mark's Place was at only 3 minutes by foot and the Rialto at 10 minutes. -The room was well furnished in venice style (king size bed, TV, mini-bar, air conditioning, and Jacuzzi in the bathroom). The hotel was very clean, and everything was provided including slippers, nail file, shaving kit and a toothbrush. But we have noticed that the hotel was divided in tow parts and we were in the new one. We can't say if the room in the old part were so well furnished. -Even if we were in low season the problem is the breakfast. There is only 15 tables and there was just the minimum ask for at the buffet (no fruit for example). You must wake up early if you don't want to wait to be seating. -The staff was friendly

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel had a great location and was very easy to get to. The hotel was located right off both the public transportation line and the Alilguna line which was the "waterbus" that took us to the airport. Probably less than a 5 minute walk to both. Also it was so close to the Piazza San Marco, beautiful to walk through every morning. Our room had a very antique feel to it. It was clean, cozy, nice. The staff was friendly and even had a breakfast box prepared for us because we had to leave the hotel in the morning before the restaurant was open for breakfast. They did have internet available in the hotel lobby for a charge which was nice. We really enjoyed our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: bluezdoc
Reviews.Content: Just returned from first trip to Italy. Started in Venice,long walk in airport to water taxi, but best way to get to hotel. Staff very friendly and helpful throughout stay. Booked Antico on-line 6 months prior based on location and trip advisor reviews. Had a superior room, larger than our friend's standard for about $10 E more. Room was nicely decorated with wood floors, bathroom appeared ? renovated/new fixtures. Standard European breakfast as described above-satisfactory. Off an alley very close to Piazza San Marco, easy to find after the first time! With the windows and shutters closed, street noise effectively blocked out and non- intrusive. No views-small street, but the location and rate can't be beat. No other amenities i.e. fitness, in room internet, but would easily need to pay double or triple to obtain at this location. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Central Location”
Reviews.Author: peacocks
Reviews.Content: We have paid more for worse hotels in England! This is in a very convenient location just metres away from St Marks Sq and so with 3 water bus stops nearby. Great for travel. This means that you can pop back easily during the day as you will probably pass close by quite often. Drop off bags and freshen up without losing much time. As with most of the central hotels for the price, it is small. Both our rooms had well appointed bathrooms with jacuzzi baths and one of our rooms had a welcome balcony stretching the length of the room. Admittedly the other had a sloping ceiling in the bathroom that caught my husband on the head. With these small hotels luck does play a part in room allocation. It is an obvious comment, but if you want identical rooms dont choose any of the small central hotels that have been converted from houses. It is not directly on a canal, so again if you want to overlook water from your bedroom, look elsewhere. However, the reality is that in Venice, you dont spend much time in your room, but are more likely to use it just as a base for changing and sleeping. The breakfast staff were very friendly and efficient. Breakfast is the standard buffet of meat and cheese, cereal, plain yoghurt, pastries, bread and tea/coffee/chocolate. The central hotel locations are all noisy, so if you are going for more than a few days, I would suggest staying for a few days here and then a few days in a quiet location off the traditional tourist beaten track. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 days in July 05, stayed in a standard room which was quaint but probably a little too small, parents stayed in a superior room with a large balcony, room 269, which was excellent and only 30 euros more. Location fantastic just off St Marks and on the main route up to Rialto Bridge. Staff very friendly and allowed us a late checkout for no extra charge.

Reviews.Title: “Great location (but a little loud...)”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Antico Panada for two nights in April 2005. It's right off of St. Mark's Square. The location is fantastic, and the price is unbeatable considering what other hotels in that are cost. It was so convenient to be able to go back to the hotel quickly to drop off items we'd bought or change our clothes or shoes with little interruption of our day. There was no breakfast, but there is so much food available in Italy, it didn't matter. The staff was helpful with directions and maps, and we even got internet access whenever we needed it. The room itself was a Venetian-style large room, with a fridge, and a VERY nice, large marble bathroom with two sinks. The only drawback was the location of our room. It faced a little popular street, and we could hear the throngs of people passing underneath our window late at night. In fairness, "late" for Venice means around 10:30 pm. The city basically shuts down around then, especially once all the cruise tourist leave. So the noise really wasn't that big a deal. Overall, we had a wonderful stay, and this hotel was a great factor in that! I would stay here again for sure (might ask for a room on a different side, though) :-)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel...”
Reviews.Author: Sara37pink
Reviews.Content: A small hotel down the alleys off of St Marks Sq. The location is perfect. The staff were extremely helpful and friendly. The rooms were very clean and decorated in the Venetian style. We took 9 family members. We arrived too early for check in, but, they had some of the rooms available and let us have the rooms were ready, which meant we could freshen up and leave all our bags, so that we could go and wander...very very nice. I would avoid the restaurants in the streets nearby, the food is not very good and expensive for what it is. Try some smaller alleyways off the beaten track where there are only 1 or two restaurants and the food improves 10 fold

Reviews.Title: “Average but Adequate”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Panada is a perfect example of the price you pay for convenience. The location is central, offering a variety of sites that are only a few steps away. If you're looking for something more than a street lined with typical touristy shops, this hotel is not for you. The street is noisy at all hours. The hallways are narrow, with tattered worn carpeting and walls that have dents in them from luggage. Like most hotels in Italy, what they call a "matrimonial" bed is nothing more than two twins pushed together. No wonder the divorce rates are so high! The bathtub is too small for an average size person. Now the good news. The staff is deightful, and the breakfast is the best served in Italy! You can change money with the front desk without the commissions. Three euros for 15 minutes of internet time is average, and conveniently located in the lobby. If your room isn't as important to you as the location, this hotel will suit you well. For those of us who consider a nice room to be a part of the vacation experience, this is just too small. Spend a little more and look for something bigger than a closet!

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: sroma1
Reviews.Content: great location, helpful staff, good value for the money - - - highly recommend

Reviews.Title: “Great location & friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: gailscout1
Reviews.Content: First time in Venice. While overwhelmed by the tourists and pigeons, my husband and I enjoyed the quietness and friendly staff here. Great location off the Square. Our double room, 3 stories above the street, had a good size bathroom and a/c. Though the breakfast is good, there is no fruit or fruit juice. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Although tucked away in a small pathway, the location of the hotel is wonderful because it is close to everything. A minute away from St Marks, and a short three minute walk to the Rialto Bridge. The Hotel has a good breakfast buffet, and the rooms were clean and more than comfortable. We didn't have any problems while we stayed at the hotel There are plenty of restaurants around the area, but try not to get anything around the 'touristy' areas, because the prices are usually higher, and the quality is usually lower.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly customer service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel on Easter vacation, and we really like the location. It's very close to the St. Mark's Square and there are many stores (Murano blown glass) close to this hotel. In front of this hotel, there's also Mc Donalds and many other Italian restaurants. The people in the receptionist desk are very friendly and helpful. They would explained a lot of information for the sight-seeing tours. During the night, is not good to open the window inside the room, because there are many mosquitos. The room is very small, but I think that is the standard room in Europe compare to here in the US. I would not mind staying in this hotel again, next time I go to Venice.

HotelInfo.Name: Antico Panada
HotelInfo.Address: San Marco, 646, 30124 Venice, Italy
